p: Taamalli and collaborators reported the analyses of the methanolic extract of Mentha pulegium performed using an UPLC-ESI-QTOF mass spectrometer coupled with a liquid chromatograph and detected metabolites from the following groups: hydroxybenzoic acids, hydroxycinnamic acids, flavanols, flavones, flavanones, flavonols, organic acids, nucleosides, amino acids, and fatty acids [ 56]. In the methanolic extract of Mentha pulegium, the authors identified a very high amount of gallocatechin.
